title: Crossed Swords
description: Lamont buys a porcelain figure for $15 from a silent movie star. After having it appraised, Lamont and Fred decide to sell it at an auction. They attend the auction pretending to be buyers to bid the price even higher. However, things go awry to Lamont's dismay.

title: Happy Birthday, Pop
description: During his birthday celebration, Fred is overwhelmed by a visit to a fancy bar, a movie theater to see Fiddler on the Roof, and dinner at a Chinese restaurant.

title: Here Comes the Bride, There Goes the Bride
description: Lamont is excited about his upcoming wedding, but on the big day he quickly finds himself the only one who is. The bride dumps him at the altar, and his relatives beg to get back their wedding gifts.

title: The Copper Caper
description: Fred and Lamont buy a load of copper from a man who has been stealing it from people in the neighborhood.

title: A Matter of Life and Breath
description: Concerned about his father's smoker's cough, Lamont brings Fred in for a free tuberculosis screening at the American Lung Association's Breathmobile. The test results take his breath away.

title: We Were Robbed
description: O, what a tangled web Fred weaves when he fakes a robbery to cover-up his careless destruction of Lamont's prized porcelain and glass collection.

title: A Pad for Lamont
description: Fed up with his father frustrating his love life, Lamont strikes out on his own and rents a swingin' bachelor pad.

title: The Great Sanford Siege
description: The Sanfords haven't been paying their bills and now find themselves trapped in their home in a standoff with a process server and a collection agency ready to repossess their unpaid furniture.

title: Coffins for Sale
description: Lamont's keeping a pair of coffins in the living room spooks superstitious Fred.

title: The Barracuda
description: Fred's in love and engaged to be married, but not if Lamont can help it.

title: TV or Not TV
description: In need of a new color television, Fred is upset when Lamont decides to spend the money instead on a new car. Lamont has a change of heart, however, when Fred wanders away from home and is taken to the hospital - with an apparent case of amnesia.

title: The Suitcase Case
description: Lamont's daily haul of junk includes a tattered briefcase stuffed with stolen cash. Will Fred and Lamont decide whether to keep it or turn it over to the police before the crook it belongs to comes looking for it?

title: The Return of the Barracuda
description: Fred and Donna kiss and make up, sparking Lamont to hatch new plans for putting the kibosh on Cupid.

title: The Piano Movers
description: It's putting the match to the powder keg when rough and tumble Fred and Lamont are engaged to remove a piano from the lavish Beverly Hills apartment of a cultured antiques collector.

title: By the Numbers
description: Freeloading family and friends flock to fleece the golden sheep when Fred plays the numbers.

title: Whiplash
description: Fred's fine following his fender bender with a Cadillac, but Bubba convinces him to claim whiplash and then lay claim to a gold mine in monetary damages.

title: The Dowry
description: Cousin Grady's overweight stepdaughter stands to receive a $10,000 dowry on her wedding day, which sets Fred to playing matchmaker with Lamont.

title: Jealousy
description: When Donna said she would be bringing a patient to dinner, Fred didn't expect the spry and sophisticated Osgood Wilcox.

title: Tooth or Consequences
description: After all else fails, fraidy-cat Fred finally agrees to see a dentist for his toothache.

title: The Card Sharps
description: Lamont won't heed Fred's warnings that he's being played for a sucker by some canny card sharps

title: Have Gun, Will Sell
description: After Fred and Lamont scare away a burglar, they realize that he left his gun at their house. Lamont and Rollo then pressure Fred into going to a pawn shop to try and sell the gun.

title: The Puerto Ricans Are Coming!
description: Fred's fighting mad to find that his new neighbor is a Puerto Rican man with a goat.

title: The Shootout
description: Lamont brings home an antique Revolutionary War rifle and Fred finds out whether it can still fire after 200 years.

title: Blood Is Thicker Than Junk
description: After a nasty spat Sanford and Son split up. Fred hires a new man to replace Lamont, who signs on to work with a competing junk dealer.

title: Sanford and Son and Sister Makes Three
description: A husband-seeking old flame of Fred's returns with a shocking revelation about her daughter, who has sparked a flaming passion in Lamont's heart.

title: A Guest in the Yard
description: Fred and Lamont discover that no good deed goes unpunished when the homeless man they help plays the Sanfords for suckers, resisting their every effort to throw him out.

title: Fred & Carol and Fred & Donna
description: Two-timing Fred's in the soup when he accidentally double books his dining room table by inviting both his fianc√©e Donna and the attractive saleswoman Carol over for supper on the same evening.

title: The Light Housekeeper
description: Lamont hires a housekeeper, but Fred isn't wild about her being white.

title: The Big Party
description: Behind on their bills, Fred and Lamont look to raise money by throwing a house party and charging admission.

title: A Visit from Lena Horne
description: Fast-thinking Fred fools Lena Horne into visiting the Sanford home after he spins her a sob story about little lame Lamont who looks upon Lena as a second mother.

title: Lamont Goes African
description: Lamont looks to reinvent himself by adopting an African name and lifestyle.

title: Watts Side Story
description: Lamont just met a girl named Maria, but she's Julio's Puerto Rican sister, and the possibility of an interracial romance ruffles the feathers of both Fred and Mrs. Fuentes.

title: The Infernal Triangle
description: Fred announces his engagement to Judy, a woman young enough to have been his daughter-in-law.

title: Pops 'n' Pals
description: Jealous of Lamont's friendship with Julio, Fred tries to be a buddy to his son.

title: Home Sweet Home for the Aged
description: Before setting off to sail the world aboard a tramp steamer, Lamont must convince Fred to move into a retirement home.

title: Pot Luck
description: Lamont takes advantage of an ignorant seller and buys an antique commode for $20, greedily anticipating reselling it for a tremendous profit.

title: The Kid
description: A lonely latchkey kid stows away on Lamont's truck and spends a day with the Sanfords.

title: Rated X
description: Fred tags along to a movie casting call that Lamont and Rollo hope will make them respected black actors, not suspecting this film is blue.

title: Lamont as Othello
description: Fred is uneasy with Lamont's rehearsing Othello with a white actress in their home, so Marilyn invites Fred and Lamont to come to her home in Beverly Hills.

title: Libra Rising All Over Lamont
description: As an astrologer tells Lamont that as a Libra he must avoid strife and arguing, hypochondriac Fred is home suffering from gas after eating eight-day-old collard greens.

title: Fred, the Reluctant Fingerman
description: Fred, fearing retaliation after witnessing a robbery at Julio's, is unwilling to get involved by describing the burglars to the police.

title: Presenting the Three Degrees
description: The Three Degrees, the Philadelphia-based singing trio, are the Sanfords' house-guests. The ladies perform "I Didn't Know" for Fred.

title: This Little TV Went to Market
description: Grady claims the television Fred got for a steal from Guy's Groovy Grabbag was indeed stolen--from him.

title: Lamont, Is That You?
description: Fred fears Lamont and Rollo are homosexuals after Bubba reports seeing them go into the Gay Blade Bar.

title: Fuentes, Fuentes, Sanford & Chico
description: Feeling betrayed when Lamont starts a sideline business with Julio, Fred moves out and into a downtown flophouse.

roles.char: Homeless Man at the Mercy Mission

title: Superflyer
description: Fred's Uncle Leotis dies and leaves him $1,500, but the catch to collecting it is Fred and Lamont must fly to St. Louis and oversee the funeral arrangements. But steady Freddy isn't sure he's ready to take his first flight in an airplane.

title: The Engagment/The Member of the Wedding
description: Fred and Donna are to be married on Sunday, but Lamont plots to put them asunder before the Lord joins them together by inviting to the wedding his Aunt Esther and the rest of Fred's irascible in-laws.

title: The Blind Mellow Jelly Collection
description: Lamont becomes annoyed that Fred is constantly playing old blues records featuring a band named Blind Mellow Jelly. Then, he finds out the records are rare and could be worth several hundred dollars.

title: A House Is Not a Pool Room
description: Lamont suffers buyer's remorse after the pool table he gave Fred for his birthday brings the boys over for billiards every day while Fred's work and girlfriend Donna go neglected.

title: Grady, the Star Boarder
description: Fred seizes a financial opportunity when Grady gripes about his neighbors' fighting: invite Grady to come live in serenity for $60 a month with him and Lamont.

title: Wine, Women and Aunt Esther
description: Depressed about death and growing old, Fred and his drinking buddies determine to think young and go for the gusto by throwing a wild party, inviting topless waitress Fast Fanny and four of her fast friends to spice it up.

title: Mama's Baby, Papa's Maybe
description: Fred's feathers get ruffled when an old friend from St. Louis comes to town claiming to be Lamont's actual father.

title: Fred Sanford, Legal Eagle
description: When Lamont gets a traffic ticket, Fred convinces him to fight it in court, where the poor man's Perry Mason steps up to defend his son against the system.

title: This Land Is Whose Land?
description: Fred, petty and prejudiced against his Puerto Rican neighbor, hires a surveyor to mark the legal property line to ensure Julio keeps his stuff off the Sanford side.

title: Fred's Cheating Heart
description: After learning about the dangers and high risk of heart disease, Lamont plots to get his heart attack-prone father to the hospital for a cardio check-up.

title: The Party Crasher
description: Lamont and Rollo don't want to invite fuddy-duddy Fred to their party with a pair of live-wire women from Detroit.

title: Lamont Goes Karate
description: Lamont learns karate to defend himself against bully Jo Jo Jackson.

title: Will the Real Fred Sanford Please Do Something?
description: A woman Fred wooed over one too many boilermakers comes looking to take him up on his marriage proposal. Betty is bent on getting satisfaction and skeptical of Grady's insisting he's not Fred

title: Tyranny, Thy Name Is Grady
description: With Fred away in St. Louis, Grady is put in charge of the house. He quickly makes his presence known by keeping Aunt Esther out and preventing Lamont from bringing girls home.

title: Aunt Esther and Uncle Woodrow Pfftt...
description: "I'm not a cream puff!" declares Uncle Woody after Grady gives him an empowering man-to-man talk and sends him home to reclaim his castle. But Aunt Esther doesn't appreciate Grady's making a man of her mouse and shows that hell hath no fury like the wife of a worm turned.

title: The Way to Lamont's Heart
description: Lamont's looking for a little lovin', but new girlfriend Judy is looking to settle down. When Lamont tells Judy he can't get married because his godfather Grady would disapprove, Judy sets to winning Grady's approval with a smile and a smoked pork butt, which sets Grady jumping to conclusions.

title: Hello Cousin Emma... Goodbye Cousin Emma
description: Grady's cousin Emma blows in from the Windy City and promises to make the living easy for the two men, but Lamont has his doubts, especially after being bumped from his bedroom and having to share a bed with Grady.

title: The Surprise Party
description: Fred returns from St. Louis to a welcome home surprise party. Lamont must exercise diplomacy and peacekeeping after he bruises the feelings of both Fred and Grady.

title: Matchmaker, Matchmaker
description: Lamont stands to inherit $7,000 if within a year he marries and has a son named after his late uncle George. Fred sees dollar signs, so he and Grady set to making marriage bells ring by turning to a computer dating service.

title: Ol' Brown Eyes
description: Fred is celebrating 35 years in the junk business and snoops and finds his intended gift: a signet ring with his initials on it that Rollo got for a good price. Then Fred learns that among the items recently stolen from Frank Sinatra's hotel room was an initialed signet ring.

title: Grady and His Lady
description: Fred fears wedding bells will break up his beautiful friendship after Grady announces he's engaged to Dolly, so Fred plots to puncture the romance.

title: There'll Be Some Changes Made
description: Lamont moves out after a fight with Fred, but Fred lures his son back by agreeing to allow Lamont's eccentric encounter group to hold its meeting in their home. This episode introduces the recurring character Ah Chew.

title: Going Out of Business
description: To get a better tax break and increase their income, Lamont gets a job as a clerk at a haberdashery and Fred considers closing down Sanford & Son.

title: Home Sweet Home
description: A Japanese real estate firm wants to buy and tear down all the properties on the Sanfords' block in order to build a brewery.

title: My Kingdom for a Horse
description: Fred buys a retired thoroughbred racehorse, betting on a big profit after selling him as a breeding stud.

title: Sanford and Niece
description: Fred's tender side is stirred when his niece Elizabeth comes to visit and bears a striking resemblance to his late wife.

title: Julio and Sister and Nephew
description: Allergic to Chico the goat, Julio's sister and young nephew stay with the Sanfords. Controversy arises when young Roberto is placed down a grade in school because of his poor English skills.

title: Fred's Treasure Garden
description: Among the vegetables growing in Grady's garden is "wild parsley," only Lamont and Rollo recognize it by a different name: marijuana!

title: Tower Power
description: A visit to a gallery of abstract art inspires Fred to create his magnum opus: a towering heap of junk.

title: A Little Extra Security
description: Grady receives an extra Social Security check by mistake and wastes no time celebrating his windfall, but the wind falls from his sails when he learns Mr. Hastings from the Social Security office is on his way over to the house.

title: The Merger
description: The Sanfords and Julio agree to merge their competing junkyards and bank on business booming after they broadcast a television commercial.

title: Once a Thief
description: Grady gets uptight when Lamont brings his ex-convict friend Herman home to stay until he can find a job.

title: The Stand-In
description: The Sanfords welcome Fred's buddies Bow Legs and Al, who are bringing their song, dance and comedy act to an LA nightclub. When Al hurts his back, Fred and Lamont step up and step out in this revue episode highlighted by Billy Eckstine singing "Jelly Jelly."

title: Strange Bedfellows
description: Praise for Lamont's impassioned call into a radio political program sparks him to run for the state assembly. Will it be Mr. Sanford goes to Sacramento?

title: The Masquerade Party
description: In this spoof of "Let's Make a Deal," Fred, Grady and Bubba appear as contestants on "Wheel and Deal," hoping to win a new car as a birthday present for Lamont.

title: Golden Boy
description: Fred hopes to get rich quick by becoming co-owner of a boxer dubbed Junior Joe Louis. It then becomes Fred and Grady's job to get Junior into fighting shape before Friday's bout.

title: My Brother-In-Law's Keeper
description: Fred is bothered and bewildered by his baby sister's marriage to a white man.

title: The Headache
description: Lamont's headache drives him to the psychologist's couch, where it is suggested the pain in Lamont's head is caused by the pain in the neck he lives with.

title: The Stung
description: Tired of Lamont telling him he's a loser at cards, Fred and his professional gambler friend play a prank on Lamont and his poker pals. But will Fred be left holding the dead man's hand?

title: The Older Woman
description: Fred and Grady don disguises to discover the cougar who has her claws in Lamont's heart.

title: The Over-the-Hill Gag
description: Lamont misunderstands the doctor and believes Fred has only six months to live and lavished love and kindness upon him. Fred's content to ride the gravy train, though it may land him in the soup.

title: The Family Man
description: The story of Grady and his eyebrow-raising gift to his daughter and son-in-law just before their cocktail party for stuffy university professors.

title: Earthquake II
description: An earthquake shakes up the Sanfords, and the threat of an even bigger quake sparks Fred to sell the house and seek shelter in Las Vegas.

title: Divorce, Sanford Style
description: Following a fight with Woodrow, Aunt Esther moves in with Fred and Lamont. Fred works overtime engineering a reconciliation so she'll return home.

title: Bank on This
description: Fred and Lamont are applying for a loan to finance their purchase of Julio's former property when a pair of robbers burst into the bank.

title: The Sanford Arms
description: With the bank ready to foreclose, Fred and Lamont desperately seek to find tenants for the Sanford Arms.

title: Steinberg and Son
description: The series spoofs itself when the characters in the new television show "Steinberg and Son" turn out to be Borscht Belt parallels to those in the life of Fred G. Sanford.

roles.char: Audience Memer at Steinberg & Son Show

title: Brother, Can You Spare an Act?
description: When Fred's white brother-in-law Rodney lands a job emceeing a local vaudeville revival, Fred, Lamont and Smiley Rogers help out by providing the song and dance.

title: Della, Della, Della
description: When two competing politicians each seek to use Fred's junkyard for a campaign headquarters, Della Reese appeals to Fred to stand by her man.

title: Donna Pops the Question
description: After receiving a proposal from another man, Donna gives Fred one final chance to marry her.

title: My Fair Esther
description: Fred becomes a latter-day Henry Higgins when he undertakes the task of transforming ugly duckling Esther into a swan so she can win the Mrs. Watts Businessman's Contest and net Fred half the prize money.

title: Sanford and Rising Son
description: Fred and Ah Chew team up and turn the Sanford home into a Japanese restaurant.

title: The Olympics
description: Jealous of Donna's athletic new boyfriend, Fred begins training so he can challenge him in the Senior Olympics.

title: Ebenezer Sanford
description: Tightfisted Fred gets a ghostly wake-up call in this spoof of "A Christmas Carol."

title: The Oddfather
description: Fred is wounded while witnessing a mob hit and is hospitalized under police protection until he can identify Mr. Big.

title: Can You Chop This?
description: Fred plans to get rich quick by selling Whopper Chopper food processors, using Lamont's acting school tuition money to make his initial investment.

title: Greatest Show in Watts
description: While babysitting an elephant, Fred holds a circus in the junkyard, allowing the cast to display their talents, especially Aunt Esther as the Bronze Goddess.

title: Fred Sanford Has a Baby
description: A very pregnant woman rents Lamont's room for the week he's away on a fishing trip.

title: The TV Addict
description: Fred's lifestyle of too much TV and too little exercise has Lamont concerned for his father's health, so Fred undergoes hypnotism to break his addiction to television.

title: Lamont in Love
description: When Lamont falls in love with a mysterious woman, Fred and Esther play amateur sleuths to learn more about her.

title: The Escorts
description: When Fred's friend Elroy can't find a date, Fred's inspired to launch his latest get rich quick scheme: an escort service for seniors.

title: The Engagement Man Always Rings Twice
description: Lamont musters the courage to pop the question to Janet.

title: The Director
description: Starstruck Fred assumes the director's chair when the champ George Foreman comes to star in a play for Lamont's theater workshop.

title: A Pain in the Neck
description: Fred's friends have got his back, as he discovers when he suffers from a backache on the day he is to receive the Watts Businessman's award and his friends rush to his aid with all kinds of quack cures.

title: Sergeant Gork
description: Fred regales young Roger with tall tales of his World war II exploits that draw more from the late movie than the history books.

title: The Camping Trip
description: Lamont brings Fred along on a camping trip to have some solitude and quality time together. Fred is no friend of nature and does nothing but complain...when the truck won't start they are stranded and begin to reminisce about old times.

title: The Hawaiian Connection: Part 1
description: Luring Fred and Lamont to Hawaii, a trio of jewel thieves plot to make Fred their mule for smuggling stolen diamonds to California.

title: The Hawaiian Connection: Part 2
description: Fred and Lamont visit Hawaii tourist attractions while running for their lives from the jewel thieves.

title: California Crude
description: While Fred and Lamont are digging a garden, oil is discovered underground at the junk yard. Fred sees millions but before any money can be paid it must first be tested.

title: The Stakeout
description: The police are looking for a fence named Alex Hacker who's been spotted coming in and out of The Sanford Arms. They use Fred and Lamont's home to stakeout the Arms. Meanwhile, Fred has a crush on a new lady tenant.

title: I Dream of Choo Choo Rabinowitz
description: Fred is determined to break Choo Choo Rabinowitz's official world record for the longest amount of time staying awake.

title: The Winning Ticket
description: A couple of con men sucker Fred into running a rigged lucky number contest for which the crooks secretly hold the winning ticket.

title: Committee Man
description: Soon after Fred is appointed to serve on a mayor's committee he is sought out by a slumlord offering a bribe for political favors.

title: Fred's Extra Job
description: Fred works nights as a bus boy in a fancy restaurant so he can begin paying back the $6,000 bank loan he took out in order to give Lamont an impressive wedding gift.

title: Carol
description: Fred's old friend Carol shows up after 40 years, stirring up memories and sparking a flashback to the Summer of 1936 when Fred was a pool hustler in Cleveland.

title: Aunt Esther Has a Baby
description: Esther and Woody plan to be parents for the first time, but for it to happen Esther is going to need Fred's help.

title: Here Today, Gone Today
description: Misunderstandings abound and compound when Fred's friends try to honor his fortieth year in business with a secret surprise.

title: Aunt Esther Meets Her Son
description: Esther and Woody welcome their son Daniel, but quickly discover they must practice the forgiveness that Esther preaches.

title: Sanford and Gong
description: Fred, Lamont, Donna and Bubba attend a taping of "The Gong Show" and are inspired to audition as contestants, bringing their musical act onto the show.

title: Fred Meets Redd
description: The fourth wall falls when Fred enters NBC's Redd Foxx look-alike contest and eagerly anticipates meeting his idol face to face.

title: The Defiant One
description: Rehearsing his magic act, Grady snaps a pair of trick shackles onto Fred and Esther, only to discover the instructions for removing them are printed in Chinese.

title: A Matter of Silence
description: Lamont fears Fred is going deaf, and Fred is content to play along and milk sympathy from Lamont and Donna.

title: When John Comes Marching Home
description: Lamont's engagement to Janet is jeopardized by the unexpected return of her ex-husband John.

title: The Reverend Sanford
description: To avoid paying taxes, Fred buys a mail-order clergy ordination and transforms his home into the Chapel on the Junkpile for the church of the Seventh-Day Junkists.

title: The Will
description: Fred suffers amnesia after being bludgeoned with Esther's silver-plated Bible. Having looked death in the face, Fred wants to get his affairs in order and so prepares his last will and testament and summons his friends for its reading.

title: Fred the Activist
description: Angered by the age discrimination policy of a local stereo dealer, Fred rallies a troop of Gray Foxes and leads the charge to change the policy.

title: The Lucky Streak
description: Fred and Lamont need to raise $4,000 by Friday or lose the Sanford Arms. Fred plans to parlay his $500 savings into the needed amount by playing poker, betting on horses and letting it ride in Las Vegas.

title: Funny, You Don't Look It
description: Inspired by Alex Haley's "Roots," Fred orders a family crest and genealogical scroll that states he's African royalty and a descendant of the Jewish Ethiopian Falashas.

title: Fred Sings the Blues
description: Aspiring songwriter Fred invites B.B. King to dinner, but panics upon reading in the blues legend's biography that the singer has sworn to get even with the man who long ago stole his St. Louis sweetheart "E.W.", a woman matching Elizabeth's description.

title: School Daze
description: For a month Fred and Bubba have been sneaking out at night, concerning family and friends and leading Donna to fear that Fred has fallen for another woman.
